User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user within the Futurise application. User documents are primarily managed by secure server-side functions for streak and point calculations. Users can read their own profile data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

lastLogin.description: Timestamp of the user's last login.

userSkills.description: A list of the user's self-identified skills.

PsychometricTest.title: PsychometricTest
PsychometricTest.description: Represents a psychometric test taken by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the psychometric test.

testDate.description: Date and time when the test was taken.

results.description: JSON string containing the test results. Actual structure depends on the test format.

CareerPrediction.title: CareerPrediction
CareerPrediction.description: Represents a career prediction generated for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the career prediction.

predictionDate.description: Date when the prediction was generated.

SkillGapAnalysis.title: SkillGapAnalysis
SkillGapAnalysis.description: Represents the analysis of skill gaps for a user towards a specific career.

id.description: Unique identifier for the skill gap analysis.

desiredRole.description: The desired job role for this analysis.

userSkills.description: The user's skills at the time of analysis.

learningPlan.description: The AI-generated learning plan in Markdown format.

roadmap.description: Structured learning roadmap with courses and links.

analysisDate.description: Date when the skill gap analysis was performed.

LearningContent.title: LearningContent
LearningContent.description: Represents a piece of learning content suggested to a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the learning content.

contentType.description: Type of content (e.g., article, video, course).

KnowledgeTest.title: KnowledgeTest
KnowledgeTest.description: Represents a knowledge test taken by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the knowledge test.

testName.description: Name or title of the knowledge test.

testDate.description: Date and time when the test was taken.

Streak.title: Streak
Streak.description: Represents a user's streak for daily engagement.

endDate.description: Date when the streak ended (if applicable).

streakLength.description: Number of consecutive days in the streak.

Reward.title: Reward
Reward.description: Represents a reward earned by a user.

rewardDate.description: Date when the reward was earned.

CommunityPost.title: CommunityPost
CommunityPost.description: Represents a post in the community chat.

id.description: Unique identifier for the community post.

createdAt.description: Date and time the post was created.

user.description: Information about the user who posted.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure data isolation and efficient querying by leveraging path-based ownership for user-specific data. Each user's data (psychometric tests, career predictions, skill gap analyses, knowledge tests, streaks, and rewards) is stored under a dedicated `/users/{userId}` collection. This approach provides clear ownership and avoids the need for complex authorization rules with `get()` calls, ensuring Authorization Independence. The CommunityPosts are stored in a top-level collection `/community_posts` since these will likely need to be queryable for all users in the application. This structural segregation ensures that different security requirements (user-owned vs. community-accessible) are handled independently. The approach of user-owned subcollections and top-level segregated collections supports QAPs, enabling secure and efficient `list` operations based on path-based ownership.
